name: A WESLEYCRUSHER Quiz | Words in Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only letters in "WESLEYCRUSHER", find a 5-letter word for a round device, like on a car.
questions.explanation:
Wheel.

	A wheel is like a tire that helps move a vehicle.  Bicycles, cars, skateboards, and rollerskates all have wheels on them.

questions.text: Using only letters in "WESLEYCRUSHER", find a 4-letter word meaning to move fast.
questions.explanation:
Rush.

	To rush means to move fast.  For instance, if you are late for school, you might have to rush to get ready in the morning.  Rush is also the name of a band!

questions.text: Using only letters in "WESLEYCRUSHER", find a 3-letter word meaning to sob.
questions.explanation:
Cry.

	To sob or weep is to cry.  If something is very sad, you might cry.  You might also cry if you are happy.

questions.text: Using only letters in "WESLEYCRUSHER", find a 4-letter word for what you see with.
questions.explanation:
Eyes.

	Most people have two eyes which allow them to see.  Eyes come in all different colors, like blue, green, black, gray, and brown.

questions.text: Using only letters in "WESLEYCRUSHER", find a 6-letter word for a dairy product that goes well with crackers.
questions.explanation:
Cheese.

	Cheese comes in hundreds of different kinds, like cheddar, mozzerella, parmesan, and asiago.  Some cheeses are good with crackers when you eat them.

questions.text: Using only letters in "WESLEYCRUSHER", find a 3-letter word that asks the reason for something.
questions.explanation:
Why.

	If someone asks why you did something, they want to know the reason.  For instance, "Why haven't you done your homework yet?" is a question asking for the reason you have not yet done your homework.  A simple answer like "Because" will not answer the question.  It asks for the reason.

questions.text: Using only letters in "WESLEYCRUSHER", find a 5-letter word that asks for the location of something.
questions.explanation:
Where.

	If someone asks you where something is, they want to know the location.  "Where is the supermarket?" is a question that asks the location of the supermarket.

questions.text: Using only letters in "WESLEYCRUSHER", find a 3-letter word for a slippery fish.
questions.explanation:
Eel.

	An eel is a long and slippery fish.  Some people like to eat eel, but others don't.  There are several kinds of eels.  Some create slime, and some even create electricity.

questions.text: Using only letters in "WESLEYCRUSHER", find a 3-letter word meaning sneaky, like a fox.
questions.explanation:
Sly.

	If someone is sneaky, they are often called "sly as a fox".  Foxes are known to be sneaky, sometimes killing animals without the animal even realizing there was a fox around.

questions.text: Using only letters in "WESLEYCRUSHER", find a 5-letter word meaning to squash or destroy.
questions.explanation:
Crush.

	If you crush something, you squash it.  For instance, if you crush a blueberry with your fingers, you have squashed it, and probably got blue all over yourself!  Also, if you win a game by a lot, you "crush" your opponent.
